New Records: The partnership of 131 runs between Jones and Gous came at 14.29 runs per over, the highest run-rate for any century partnership at the T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Aaron Jones scored an unbeaten 94 off 40 balls.
USA won by 7 wickets with 14 balls remaining.
Jones and Gous had a 131-run partnership.
Navneet Dhaliwal scored 61 off 44 balls for Canada.
Nicholas Kirton scored 51 off 31 balls for Canada.
Harmeet Singh took 1/27 in 4 overs for USA.
Corey Anderson took 1/29 in 3 overs for USA.
Dilon Heyliger took 1/19 in 3 overs for Canada.
Kaleem Sana took 1/34 in 4 overs for Canada.
Pre-Game Insights: USA were favorites against Canada in the opener.
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel praised the team's overall effort and highlighted the importance of fearless cricket.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar acknowledged the good total but pointed out the exceptional batting by Jones and Gous.
Aaron Jones expressed happiness in taking the team over the line and emphasized his power-hitting abilities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.
The match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
USA won the toss and elected to field first.
The pitch had good bounce and got better for batting in the second innings with dew settling in.
Canada lost to USA for the fifth-straight time in T20Is.
